page.title: 05FARMING ON THE DOWNS
page.content: Five farmers work this downland area. The 1842 tithe map shows the same field boundaries, and at that time there was considerable arable land. Today the Mossops of Rathfinny farm 600 acres in an east to west strip from the Alfriston Road to the fields known as Hobbs Hawth at the foot of Blackstone Hill. They rotate cereal crops and have their own machinery for drilling and harvesting. Mr Lewis of Berwick Court works arable crops on the land bordering the South Downs Way, again using his own machinery and men. Mr. Hecks of Ripe abuts his land on these farms and Mr. White's of Bishopstone, having taken over 1000 acres, all arable, from the Firle Estate. Other fields are let out for grazing.
